titleStmt.title: [Testimony] 1843 Nov. 3 [of] David Taylor and Gideon Morgan : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Testimony] 1843 Nov. 3 [of] David Taylor and Gideon Morgan
bibl.note: This document is a sworn statement dated November 3, 1843 given by David Taylor and Gideon Morgan regarding the marriage of Rebecca Henson, of Cherokee descent and Preston Starritt. See also pa0252, pa0254, and pa0255.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

keywords.term: Cherokee Indians -- Legal status, laws, etc.

div.p: the undersigned are acquainted with Preston Starritt have visited him at his Residence are also acquainted with his wife formerly Rebecca Henson of Cherokee decent Know that they are Regard as man and wife they live as Such and we So Regard them, November 3rd 1843

closer.name: David Taylor
closer.add:
Sworn before me this
4 Day of November 1843
Jno Jonathan D McPherson seal

Deposition
David Taylor
& Gideon Morgan
as to the marriage of
Preston Starritt

945
Fourth Commission
Rebecca Starritt
vs versus Improvement
The United States
filed with former board
N. D. Miller, Secy Secretary Decree rendered June
12, 1847, rejected claim
N. D. Miller, Secy
